stories.title: UltraRAM Breakthrough Moves Us Closer to a Unified RAM and Storage Solution

stories.text:
Hey HN, Iâ€™m in the middle of building an OSS project while working for my current employer. I would ideally like to keep my project under a community namespace so I can continue to develop it if I leave the company.

I would love advice on ways to approach this. I see real success stories in things like Kubernetes and Kafka, where the developers got to work on the products at their day job but still keep them out of company control.
stories.title: Advice on maintaining ownership of an OSS project while working for a company

stories.text:
Fellow HN mobile enthusiasts -

Native apps have now had a decade to evolve - where do y'all learn about what has worked and what hasn't across the board - Tech, Architecture, UX, Product, Structuring teams?

(Sneaky Related 2nd Question) Who/what are the experts, podcasts, writers, blogs, researchers you admire?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you keep on native mobile state-of-the-art?
